intro: Cirsium rassulovii, commonly known as the Armenian thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring spiny leaves and purple to pinkish flower heads. It thrives in rocky and dry environments, often found in alpine and subalpine zones. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
